Replicating the analysis of Skene et al, 2020

genetics
scRNA
Author

Arvid Harder

Published

June 29, 2022

This past month has got me interested in the intersection of neuroscience and genetics - especially how to combine single-cell RNA sequencing data with that of genome-wide association studies. There are several foundational papers in this intersection, and here i replicate the analysis from a paper focusing on brain disorders - Genetic identification of cell types underlying brain complex traits yields insights into the etiology of Parkinson’s disease.

To get started we first download some data!

  • scRNA data

  • GWAS of major depressive disorder

  • GWAS of schizophrenia

  • GWAS of bipolar disorder

Download data

Code 

# First we download the aggregated gene expression data for 265 clusters of cell-types from
# adolescent mouse brain
wget https://storage.googleapis.com/linnarsson-lab-loom/l5_all.agg.loom

# MDD
wget -O mdd.gz https://datashare.ed.ac.uk/bitstream/handle/10283/3203/PGC_UKB_depression_genome-wide.txt?sequence=3&isAllowed=y

# Bipolar disorder
wget -O bip.gz https://figshare.com/ndownloader/files/26603681

# Schizophenia
wget -O scz.gz https://figshare.com/ndownloader/files/34517807

# testing update
echo hello

Prepare gene-sets based on the level 4 cell-types

For ease of visualization i will prepare gene-sets from each of the level 4 cell-types, as plotting 265 cell-types is slightly overkill. We start off by loading our packages,and defining some helper functions.

Code 
library(data.table)
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(rhdf5)
library(janitor)
library(fs)
library(glue)

scale_to_1tpm <- function(tbl, var) {
  stopifnot("expr" %in% colnames(tbl))
  tbl %>% 
    group_by(.data[[var]]) %>% 
    mutate(expr = expr*1000000 / sum(expr)) %>% 
    ungroup()
}

gene_specificity <- function(tbl, var) {
  # Here we compute the central metric: gene specificity.
  # Gene specificty isa %, how much of the genes total expression over all tissues
  # is in the index cell-type?
  
  tbl %>% 
    group_by(.data[[var]]) %>% 
    mutate(specificity = expr/sum(expr)) %>% 
    ungroup()
}


extract_top_10_pct <- function(tbl) {
  tbl %>% 
    arrange(desc(specificity)) %>% 
    slice_head(n = round(nrow(.)/10))  
}

munge_magma_genesets <- function(tbl, name) {
  tbl %>%
    # make the cell type names easy to work with
    mutate( name := make_clean_names({{ name }}))
  
}

# open aggregated expr data
